body.p:
HARRODSBURG SAVINGS INSTITUTION,
DIRECTORS.
A. M. VANARSDALL.
B. B. CAMPBELL.
JAS. TAYLOR.
R. M. DAVIS.
A. G. KYLE, PRESIDENT
J. W. CARDWELL, CASHIER

On the rect of our Guns (for which we are indeted to you) Lieut Carrey informed me that the Superintendent at the Arsenal told him there was no moulds with the Guns but if I would send him the Lead he would mould me the Bullets & Make Cartridges I accordingly Sent 200 #. of Lead and requestd Qr Mr Genl West to have it run into Balls and made into Cartridges & to send me Caps enough to use with the Cartridges On Yesterday I recd the Enclosed letter from Qr. Mr Genl West -- Now if you Can grant me a requisition for the moulding of the 200 # Lead With Cartridges & Caps I will be
be greatly obliged. --
We want to try our Guns for as to get the various distances merly to practice a few shots.
We do not expect to use our Guns only in accordance with Kentucky Law -- and hope you will grant our request,
As I have furnished the Lead now in Care of Genl West if it is required I will pay for the Powder & Caps & pay for Expense of Making them up
Do I ask too much to give this your personal attention & if you can grant the requisition please hand it to Genl West
Please let me hear from you at yr Earliest Convenience

Yr Obt Sert
J. W. Cardwell
Now we have no balls & no moulds to make them --
